sub_title: Technical Expert for Living Future Europe // Architect | Architectural Heritage Specialist | Digital Curator
summary:
I am an Architect, specialised in the Conservation of the Architectural Heritage, working as a Technical Expert and Advisor for Living Future Europe [LFE]. For more than a year, I have been collaborating with the New European Bauhaus [NEB] team from the European Commission on behalf of LFE - a NEB partner, and independently, as external evaluator. Also, in October, 2022, I have joined the team of one the firsts NEB based Horizon Europe projects as a Technical Expert in urban renovation. I am currently based in Amsterdam, having previously worked and lived in Paris, Brussels and London. 

As a Cultural Manager in Romania, since 2006, I have developed structured methods of bottom-up urban analysis aiming for the reactivation of the architectural heritage, such as the ‘Mourning Houses’ project, or ‘EDRAH - Economic Development in Relation to the Architectural Heritage’, which was tested for the first time in Giurgiu.

As an Architect for the Belgian Architecture Office ORIGIN - Architecture & Engineering’ specialised in the restoration of historical monuments, in 2018, I had the opportunity to work on a multitude of projects, tackling various philosophies of interventions, contextual problematics, scales of intervention, and development phases. This practical experience concluded a formative path that began in 2008 with my work experience as a junior architect at the Romanian - American Architecture Office, ‘Lauster & Radu’, followed by an internship in 2011 at ‘LAN Architecture’ in Paris. In 2020, I co-founded an architecture office in Bucharest, ALA Studio, in association with two other female colleagues.

Every now and then, I do independent research, such as ‘Bucharest, the little Paris?’ [2010], or the more recent challenge, ‘The theatres of Fellner & Helmer. Subtle reflections on local specificities and identitary values’, a project supported by the Austrian Embassy in Romania that started in 2020 and it is about to step into the spotlight in the later part of 2023 with a traveling exhibition and multi-media content on a dedicated platform. 

From the volunteer based project in Bucharest, The Mourning Houses [2006] to the EU funded cross-sectoral international cooperation between more than 30 partners in 7 countries aiming for the sustainable urban rehabilitation of 7 lighthouse projects expected to be operative by 2025, my path has always been a process towards working on regenerating urban spaces and in intercultural contexts, which now comes in-line with this New European Bauhaus movement that I am so honoured, proud and grateful to be part of.

treasury_media.title: GRIRO_Historical Analysis of an Industrial Site in Bucharest
treasury_media.description: The historical study for the GRIRO industrial site aims to gain a deeper understanding on the environmental conditions that determined the creation and the evolution of the urban structure, as well as the actual relation with the neighbouring areas. The research is meant to define a specific framework for preserving and repurposing the heritage values and traces in case of future transformations.

treasury_media.title: UZINA DE APĂ GIURGIU – catalizator social și simbol pentru modernitate
treasury_media.description: Prezentarea de față este realizată pe fondul elaborării proiectului “CONSERVAREA, RESTAURAREA ȘI AMENAJAREA CA SPAȚIU EXPOZIȚIONAL A UZINEI DE APĂ GIURGIU. Valorizarea memoriei patrimoniale prin activarea spațiului ca reper local pentru activități cultural educaționale” realizat de ALA Studio în parteneriat cu Asociația Rhabillage, pentru Apa Service Giurgiu, în baza unei finanțări din partea Institutului Național al Patrimoniului, prin Timbrul Monumentelor Istorice, în 2022.

treasury_media.title: PODUL BIZETZ. Model de rigoare estetică pentru podurile metalice de la 1900
treasury_media.description: Prezentarea de față este realizată pe fondul elaborării proiectului “Restaurarea, consolidarea, protejarea și amenajarea pietonală a Podului Bizetz” coordonat de STASISIN Services în parteneriat cu Asociația Rhabillage, pentru Primăria Municipiului Giurgiu, în baza unei finanțări din partea Institutului Național al Patrimoniului, prin Timbrul Monumentelor Istorice, în 2020.

treasury_media.title: Moda în arhitectură
treasury_media.description: Johann Joachim Winckelmann, iluminist german din secolul al XVIII-lea, este considerat de mulți cercetători unul dintre fondatorii arheologiei științifice și întemeietorul istoriei artei. În viziunea lui, imitația nu implică reproducerea întocmai a...

treasury_media.title: Une histoire roumaine dans le contexte européen | La Pierre d’Angle
treasury_media.description: Suite à sa visite en 2005, l’historien français François Loyer disait de Bucarest qu’il est dommage d’être appelé “le petit Paris” car cette ville semble avoir une identité propre. Il incarne diverses influences et beaucoup de Paris, mais d’une...

treasury_media.title: Urban Experience #3
treasury_media.description:
Radio interview, on art7.fm 

Maria DUDA is challenging you to an urban experience with Loredana STASISIN, an activator of the architectural heritage in Bucharest since studenthood. A talk about the good practice in rehabilitation via RePAD Guide, on mixing economic pragmatism and art and smart ways to integrate and valorise the architectural heritage of Bucharest.

awards.title: Certificate of participation for the European contest REGENERATION
awards.description:
REGENERATION 64 hours European competition // Italy // Living Building Challenge Contest

It is a design workshop in which teams composed of young professionals are called to develop a project of sustainable requalification of an existing public building for the local community

Every team should respond to specific requirements defined in the announcement Integrative design, synergistic development of the project and sharing of expertise are necessary prerogatives to tackle this challenge

The purpose of the competition is to show the best sustainable regeneration project for the existing building in terms of architecture, energy efficiency, livability and relationship with social, urban and natural context

awards.title: 30 under 30
awards.description: For the 3rd time in a row, in 2014, Forbes Romania through the annual special edition 30 under 30, honoured courage, innovation, excellence and good initiatives, awarding the most impressive evolutions of the young generation in the past years.

awards.title: Creation residency in Paris for the project BUCHAREST, THE LITTLE PARIS?
awards.description: The creation residency was meant to support the project 'Bucuresti, micul Paris?' [Bucharest, the little Paris?], a comparative urban analysis through photographic techniques.

organizations.name: Interpret Europe - The European Association for Heritage Interpretation

projects.title: Bucarest, le petit Paris?
projects.description:
5 years after the debut of the comparative study, 'Bucharest, the little Paris?' returns to its birthplace.

The innovative nature of this work results from the complex approach on the issued matter, the mix between a rather technical and urban study and an artistic vision, free and even playful at once. Based on a systematic and structured approach, the results to be shown in the exhibition are presented in a formal way, graphic and of complex composition. The mirrored hypostases are designed to attract the viewer's attention without guiding him towards a predetermined conclusion.

contributors.headline: Technical Expert for Living Future Europe // Architect | Architectural Heritage Specialist | Digital Curator

projects.title: RePAD
projects.description:
Addressed to a wide range of urban actors, old building owners, real estate investors, professionals, local government, RePAD aims to:
. provide an overview of the correct integration of the architectural heritage in the urban development process
. help the development of a professional community, better informed and who has better interdisciplinary communication skills
. assist real estate investors in developing high quality rehabilitation projects in line with current trends
. ensure good communication with local government and help the development of urban strategies in relation to the architectural heritage
. create supporting documents for better public information concerning the proper intervention on Architectural Heritage

The RePAD project is the first tool for the proper rehabilitation of the Romanian architectural heritage in the social, economical and cultural context of sustainable development.

projects.title: Fluid Perceptions
projects.description:
An interactive photo exhibition by Serban Scrieciu, also featuring works by Loredana Brumă

The exhibition oscillates between the slow paced rhythm of the village, with its vanishing identity, and the Romanian urban space, forever in transition, with its seemingly transforming geometry – both suspended in time.

Escaping those usual discursive traps, the photographers eliminate the glass walls behind which images are typically encased, and invite visitors to interact with the works by leaving their own interpretations and word associations on the card mounts. Another kind of subjectivity may emerge and new narratives on society’s developments may form through the public’s participation.

contributors.headline: Technical Expert for Living Future Europe // Architect | Architectural Heritage Specialist | Digital Curator

projects.title: SurExpositions // Miettes de Paradis
projects.description:
Fragments of Paradise is the title of the edition of SurExpositions that brings together four young photographers: Cindy Lelu and Magali Paulin representing France, Loredana Bruma and Ștefan Tuchilă representing Romania. 

How we relate to the idea of ​​paradise today, here in Romania, in Timisoara? Is there a paradise in gardens, backyards, behind windows? Is it the paradise a dream to follow, an ideal to conquer or an idea too old to materialize in built places? Can we, in a few days, with the view of an outsider urban explorer to collect fragments or pick a few bits of paradise?

contributors.headline: Technical Expert for Living Future Europe // Architect | Architectural Heritage Specialist | Digital Curator

projects.title: Building Greener Schools
projects.description:
Câlnic School is a primary and middle school situated in the heart of Transylvania/ Romania, where 120 students from 6 to 14 years old are studying. The small community of 3,000 people is proud to have its school building - an old world heritage building included in the UNESCO list - participate in the RoGBC's project: “Building Greener Schools”. This project is a complex one, combining two directions:
. ecological education of the 120 students, of the 26 teachers of this school and of the local authority – the owner of the Câlnic school;
. refurbishment of the building, ensuring the highest possible green criteria.

This school has been chosen among other 6 kindergarten and schools around Romania, whose students participated in a contest for the most ecological initiative carried out in their school.

projects.title: 30 Social Housing Units - Paris - Secteur Frequel - Fontarabie, France
projects.description:
Program: Social Housing
Location: Paris - Secteur Frequel - Fontarabie, France
Timetable: 2006
Client: Paris Habitat
Cost: € 5 M Excl. VAT
Surface: 2450
Phase: PRO
Team: LAN, LGX Ingénierie (all-trades engineers), Franck Boutté Agency (HEQ)


The project is a commission from OPAC (Paris public planning and construction department), the largest public housing agency in France, for low budget and ecological dwellings, achieving precise social criteria and representing a pioneering approach taken to sustainable development in terms of layout.

projects.title: 75 apartment complex - ZAC de la Marine, France
projects.description:
Program: Construction of 74 housing units
Location: ZAC de la Marine, France
Timetable: 2011
Client: VINCI Immobilier
Cost: 7M € HT
Surface: 5410 m²
Phase: DCE 
Team: LAN, DAL BETC (structure), S2T Fluides Thermiques (surveyor + HEQ), AVLS (acoustics)

Building a new residential quarter at Colombes involved first trying to understand and define the way the town is lived in, and then recreating an evolved and contemporary version of this. 

The project is aiming for HEQ certification.

contributors.headline: Technical Expert for Living Future Europe // Architect | Architectural Heritage Specialist | Digital Curator

projects.title: Urban Renovation Genicart district - Lormont, France
projects.description:
Program: Rehabilitation of 709 housing units, relandscaping and creation of a new car park.
Location: Genicart district - Lormont, France
Timetable: 2009
Client:Domofrance
Cost: € 16,8 M excl. VAT
Surface: 70 700 m²
Phase: DCE
Team: LAN, Agence Franck Boutté (HEQ), BASE (landscape architect), Beterem ingénierie (BET and TCE)

The Génicart district is located near the centre of Lormont and is close to the town’s main urban and interurban roads. The buildings to be renovated are in the Génicart ‘South’ sector, composed of four residential groups: Saint-Hilaire (three buildings, 387 units), Leroy (two buildings, 114 units), La Boétie (two buildings, 105 units) and Villon (2 buildings, 104 units). 

An ambitious urban and social renovation project is now underway. The architectural intervention concerns access to the buildings, their entrance halls and the transformation of their facades, and involves a sustainable approach to energy economy and environmental quality.

authors.headline: Technical Expert for Living Future Europe // Architect | Architectural Heritage Specialist | Digital Curator

profile_positions.description:
The EU-funded project Eyes Hearts Hands Urban Revolution (EHHUR) is developing and testing a robust co-design methodology for 7 Lighthouses in Europe and Associated Countries (DK, EL, BE, PT, TK, HR, IT) that integrate the New European Bauhaus and EU Missions.

The work as Technical Expert at Living Future Europe for the EHHUR project mainly focuses on implementing the WP4 on ‘Buildings and Districts renovation’ along with the partners Roma Tre University, RINA Consulting and Centre for Research and Technology Hellas, aiming to develop a catalogue of best practice solutions and integrated selection, design and supply training sessions for local authorities and other professionals involved in urban restoration, produce feasibility studies for the implementation of the selected solutions, and support their implementation during the demonstration activities.
profile_positions.title: Technical Expert

profile_positions.description:
Living Future Europe (LFE) is a non-profit association with the mission to make the world work for 100% of humanity, in the shortest possible time, through spontaneous cooperation without ecological offense or disadvantage of anyone, catalysing the transformation toward communities that are socially just, culturally rich, and ecologically restorative.

The LFE Technical Advisory Group (TAG) includes selected experts from all over Europe and is working on analysing, comparing, and producing documents & reports on 
• specific regional standard changes for the adoption of International Living Future Institute (ILFI) certification
• crosswalk documents on ILFI programs and other standards or policies relevant to the Europe
• harmonisation between ILFI programs and the existing / in progress regulations at a European or National level
profile_positions.title: Vice-chair of the TAG [Technical Advisory Group] for Living Future Europe

profile_positions.description: Breakfast at K51 - A Living Future for our Past. Rehabilitation workshop of the abandoned building in Keyenveld Street, 51, Brussels -  Side event, part of the NEB Fest 2022, in cooperation with UCLouvain, LOCI Lab, KU Leuven, Communa, Vibe
profile_positions.title: Co-designer & Co-coordinator for a side event at the NEB Fest 2022

profile_positions.description:
STASISIN Services is an experienced facilitator  of cultural experiences
via digital technologies. 
▪ We support the preservation of cultural heritage through digital means
▪ We facilitate public access to cultural data and experiences through digital technologies
▪ We encourage sustainable local development based on interdisciplinary cooperation, contextual analysis and valorisation of local specificities
▪ We foster the integration of vulnerable people into the labour market through professional training and skill specialisation in the field of digital technologies.
▪ We seek to explore new digital and cultural territories that stand for the development of more INCLUSIVE, EQUITABLE and RESPONSIBLE communities.
▪ We hope to become a nursery for responsible entrepreneurs in the field of creative industries in areas with cultural potential and economically disadvantaged.
▪ For us, the limits, be they socio-economic, political or technological, translate into opportunities to activate local identitary values and integrate them into medium and long-term economic development policies and strategies.
profile_positions.title: Digital Curator

profile_positions.description: We bring our creative thinking and make full use of contemporary art language and interactive cleverness to translate deep historical research projects into accessible experiences for future communities. Our work is focused on the integration of the cultural heritage in the urban development process. We pay particular attention to the social aspects involved and the multidisciplinary approach in the sustainable evolution of urban and rural communities. Gathering a wide range of knowledge, we merge our expertise as researchers, practitioners, advocates or public officers and develop new fields of study by raising daring questions and producing new tools. Together we can prepare a better future for our past.
profile_positions.title: President // Project Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
My focus is on city imagery, street photography, urban landscapes and architectural details, experimenting both with film and digital technology. 

Since 2010, I exhibited images in Bucharest, Timișoara, Paris and London, within independent projects or international collaborations.
profile_positions.title: Photographer

profile_positions.description: historical restoration projects for industrial monuments in Giurgiu, the Water Treatment Plant [1910] & Bizetz Bridge [1905].
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder / Lead - Architect

company.name: Institutul Național pentru Cercetare și Formare Culturală

profile_positions.company: Institutul Național pentru Cercetare și Formare Culturală
profile_positions.description: Author of two chapters ('Building Stories' and 'Fashion in Architecture'), part of the digital textbook 'Heritage for the next century', initiated by the National Institute for Research and Cultural Training, financed by the Romanian Government through the Ministry of Culture and National Identity within the program of projects, events and actions dedicated to the Centenary of the Great Union (1918-2018) and the First World War .  Based on the results of a sociological study on adolescent attitudes towards national cultural heritage, the project proposes a national awareness and education campaign on the need to protect national cultural heritage and combat vandalism against historical monuments. The campaign calls for alternative education tools - augmented reality, new technologies and media forms, digital interactive education tools and digital art.
profile_positions.title: Contributing Author

profile_positions.description: Origin Architecture & Engineering consists of a team of architects, engineers and technical experts, who offer general approaches including historical studies, stability surveys and technical solutions. The office is specialised in the restoration and renovation of monument and sites. Most of the restored buildings are protected or listed on an inventory of buildings with exceptional heritage values.
profile_positions.title: Architect
